alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 04 at 2:30AM MST until March 05 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Six to 14 inches possible for the Ferris, Seminoe and Shirley Ranges, North and Central Laramie Range, and Shirley Basin. Four to 8 inches possible for the North Snowy Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHERE...Ferris, North and Central Laramie, Seminoe, and Shirley Mountain Ranges. North Snowy Range Foothills and South Laramie Range Foothills. Shirley Basin. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions possible due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range Foothills
